page.title: 19Local Government-Hutton Area
page.content: This area is administered by the North York Moors National Park Committee, and the North Yorkshire County Council There is no school at Hutton le Hole and Gillamoor Primary School has 26 pupils. Each village has a Parish Council of five elected nembers with an appointed Clerk. They normally serve for four years and quarterly meetings are held with other meetings as necessary. A Parish Meeting is held prior to a Council Meeting should the business be of a controversial nature. In all planning applications the Parks Dept,asks the Council for observations The Council liaises with all local government depts to ensure the well keeping of the village. The management of the moorland and Hutton Common is under the jurisdiction of the Manor of Spaunton Court Leet.
